title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
description: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

items.content_html:
A server-side request forgery (SSRF) vulnerability exists in Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2. This can be exploited by an authenticated user with admin privileges to manipulate shipment methods to execute arbitrary code.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7913
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20211206084839/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.2-2.2.9-and-2.1.18-security-update-13
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-hppc-rpfp-r8qw
items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition SSRF vulnerability

items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition SSRF vulnerability

items.content_html:
Insufficient enforcement of user access controls in Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2 could enable a low-privileged user to make unauthorized environment configuration changes.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7904
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20211206084839/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.2-2.2.9-and-2.1.18-security-update-13
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-5hcx-vg88-hgpm

items.content_html:
A reflected cross-site scripting vulnerability exists in the admin panel of Magento Open Source prior to 1.9.4.2, and Magento Commerce prior to 1.14.4.2, Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2 when the feature that adds a secret key to the Admin URL is disabled.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7887
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20220121051916/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.2-2.2.9-and-2.1.18-security-update-23
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-rj8f-g5gm-jw5c
items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition Cross-site Scripting Vulnerability

items.content_html:
A reflected cross-site scripting vulnerability exists in the admin panel of Magento Open Source prior to 1.9.4.2, and Magento Commerce prior to 1.14.4.2, Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2 when the feature that adds a secret key to the Admin URL is disabled.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7887
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20220121051916/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.2-2.2.9-and-2.1.18-security-update-23
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-rj8f-g5gm-jw5c

items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition Cross-site Scripting Vulnerability

items.content_html:
A stored cross-site scripting vulnerability exists in the admin panel of Magento Open Source prior to 1.9.4.2, and Magento Commerce prior to 1.14.4.2, Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2. This could be exploited by an authenticated user with privileges to newsletter templates.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7875
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20220121051916/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.2-2.2.9-and-2.1.18-security-update-23
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-qmwh-rh2g-3682

items.content_html:
A cross-site request forgery vulnerability exists in Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2. This can result in unintended deletion of the store design schedule.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7873
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20220121011306/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.2-2.2.9-and-2.1.18-security-update-33
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-8578-mmf4-f327

items.content_html:
A server-side request forgery (SSRF) vulnerability exists in Magento Open Source prior to 1.9.4.2, and Magento Commerce prior to 1.14.4.2, Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2. This can be exploited by an authenticated user with access to the admin panel to manipulate system configuration and execute arbitrary code.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7911
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20211206084839/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.2-2.2.9-and-2.1.18-security-update-13
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-33cj-w75f-49m2

items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition Server-Side Request Forgery vulnerability

items.content_html:
The slub_events (aka SLUB: Event Registration) extension through 3.0.2 for TYPO3 allows uploading of arbitrary files to the webserver. For versions 1.2.2 and below, this results in Remote Code Execution. In versions later than 1.2.2, this can result in Denial of Service, since the web space can be filled up with arbitrary files.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-16700
  • https://extensions.typo3.org/extension/slub_events
  • https://typo3.org/security/advisory/typo3-ext-sa-2019-017/
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-5pww-3mfc-g8vr
items.title: [slub/slub-events] slub_events for Typo3 Arbitrary File Upload

items.content_html:
A stored cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability exists in Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.3 or 2.3.2-p1. An authenticated admin user can inject arbitrary JavaScript code when creating a content page via page builder.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-8148
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20220121051105/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.3-and-2.2.10-security-update
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-86pc-6mm8-542r
items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition XSS Vulnerability
